architecture.augmentations.equipment

Class Equipment

  • java.lang.Object
    • architecture.augmentations.equipment.Equipment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Item
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Armor, Weapon

    public abstract class Equipment
extends java.lang.Object
implements Item
    A class to describe general equipment. Equipment stores and calculates boost totals (extra bonuses to equipment stats). Generating boost values, base stats, and other Equipment type-specific tasks are handled by children classes (Weapon, Armor, etc.).

    • Method Detail

      • addBoost

        public void addBoost(AttributeBoost boost)
        Equipment cannot be in use to upgrade.
        Parameters:
        boost - the boost to add

      • initializeBoosts

        protected void initializeBoosts()
        Called when equipment is instantiated; calculates stats based on boosts. If a boost is added after Equipment instantiation, addBoost(AttributeBoost boost) is used to calculate instead.

      • generateSpecialBoosts

        protected static java.util.List<AttributeBoost> generateSpecialBoosts(int level)
        TODO Add a boost to the player's attributes
        Parameters:
        level - Current level of the player.
        Returns:
        A list of boosts the player gets from various sources.

      • types

        public abstract java.lang.String[][] types()
        Stores a list of types of equipment. Implementation of Weapon stores types of weapons, implementation of Armor stores types of armor, etc.
        Returns:
        String[] of equipment types

      • generateFactor

        protected static double generateFactor(int boostLimit,
                                       int level,
                                       int startingLevel)
        Generates the factor used to calculate number of boosts.
        Parameters:
        boostLimit - the average total number of boosts possible (as level approaches infinity)
        level - relative number of boosts
        startingLevel - the level from which boosts could possibly appear
        Returns:
        the boost factor

      • generateVar

        protected static double generateVar(double radius)
        Generates a random number between radius and -radius to be added.
        Parameters:
        radius - positive and negative limit of random number
        Returns:
        variability value
